subject: Boost uri update
commitMessage:
Boost uri update

Update to the latest version of boost::uri

The newest version of boost uri makes some breaking changes that we need
to account for.  At the same time, we take the opportunity to move to
the error code based parse methods that don't rely on exceptions.

The biggest changes are:
The standalone build is no longer present.  A discussion with the
boost::url maintainers shows that our best option is to do a simple
copy of the headers, and compile boost/url/src.hpp in a separate file.
This is intended to allow people to pull the library in "standalone" and
not have to rely on the build machinery in boost-url, which we don't
really need.  Interestingly, this file doesn't have a newline at the
end, which clang correctly flags.  OpenBMC doesn't really need that
warning, as we rely on clang-format to do that, so we add
-Wno-newline-eof clang to get the code to compile there.

All url parsers are moved to the parse_uri, or parse_relative_uri
equivalents.  This slightly tightens the requirements around what URLs
are accepted, but in no ways that should break anything.  (Ie,
"/redfish/v1" is no longer accepted for a virtual media endpoint.

boost::urls::url_view::params_type has been renamed to
query_params_type, and the relevant methods have been updated.

Because of the missing standalone mode, we now need to use
boost::string_view which doesn't implicitly construct from
std::string_view.  Some discussion on the boost list shows that this is
coming soon, so that cruft can eventually be cleaned up, but for now we
need the construction.

Tested:
Loaded in qemu, and ran some URLs (/redfish/v1 and /redfish/v1/Chassis)
to ensure that the url handler functions as intended.

Signed-off-by: Ed Tanous <edtanous@google.com>
Change-Id: I5843776d4ec01b4d92af2ee3a9cf1ebb1d920ae7

> Patch Set 7: Verified+1

> Overriding Verified just in case Andrew wants to merge this this weekend.

Lost the verified on the rebase. 
I guess I would like to see this pass CI before we merge. Why can't the yocto update merge, then this get rebased ?

Patch Set 8:

> Patch Set 8:
> 
> > Patch Set 7: Verified+1
> > 
> > Overriding Verified just in case Andrew wants to merge this this weekend.
> 
> Lost the verified on the rebase. 
> I guess I would like to see this pass CI before we merge. 

Needs Andrew to merge https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc-build-scripts/+/47029 to see CI pass, then this, then the rebase patchset needs updated with the new sha1s from bmcweb, ideally all in rapid succession to avoid breaking people.

> Why can't the yocto update merge, then this get rebased ?

Because bmcweb doesn't build with the newest version of boost-uri, because the authors made API incompatible changes, and removed that standalone build at the same time.  In theory we could port in the old recipe, then update it later, but that seems like more effort than just squashing this stuff into the subtree rebase.

Done
I am confused how this is related?

I'll mention it in the commit message, but apparently src/boost_url.cpp doesn't have a newline at the end of it, and clang throws up on it.  Considering it's clang only, and clang-format already enforces that for our code, it seemed unimportant to have the compiler warning.
Done
Why do we need this?
Will answer in the commit message.  The short version is that the header-only mode in boost-url is gone in the latest version.
Done

This is just the latest from when you created this commit: 
https://github.com/CPPAlliance/url/commits/develop

Seems reasonable

This is the version that yocto points to.....  Vinnie develops too fast for us.

It sounds like this library is getting worked on to just be included in boost, so hopefully this whole mess just goes away shortly.

to anyone watching, this is a temporary fix to get unit tests compiling.  In the end, we probably need to just put all the unit tests into a single executable to avoid this problem entirely, but that's a larger patch than I can make today and needs some more thought.
